meanings.definition: The quality or state of being thin and resembling a thread.
meanings.sent1: The threadiness of the fabric made it delicate and easy to tear.
meanings.sent2: The spider silk had a natural threadiness that made it perfect for weaving.
meanings.sent3: The threadiness of the spaghetti was so extreme that it looked like a plate of tiny strings.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a threadiness to it that reminded him of golden silk.
meanings.sent5: The threadiness of the rope was so pronounced that it seemed to unravel at the slightest touch.

meanings.definition: The tendency to form threads or become thread-like.
meanings.sent1: The threadiness of the yarn made it easy to knit into a cozy scarf.
meanings.sent2: The threadiness of the plant's roots allowed it to spread quickly in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The threadiness of the conversation led to a tangled mess of misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The threadiness of the clouds in the sky resembled wisps of cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The threadiness of the story's plot kept unraveling with unexpected twists and turns.
